style=\"text-align:justify;\">\nA sheathed Keris Agung symbolises the strength and the wholeness of the Malays. The motif on the Keris Agung is apt for the meaning and the aim of its creation. The motif represents the King, Seri Paduka Baginda Yang di-Pertuan Agong, as the Chancellor of UiTM, and simultaneously represents UiTM as a premier Bumiputera institution of higher learning.\n<br \/><br \/>\nThe natural and genuine characteristics of a Malay keris in the Keris Agung represent the philosophy behind the establishment of Universiti Teknologi MARA. These were adapted from the creation of a keris known as Keris Potong Barat.\n<br \/><br \/>\nThe motif on the hilt of Keris Agung is a yellow gourd flower. The hilt ring features a bamboo shoot motif, and the sheath is adorned with Bunga Tanjung (Mimusops Elengi).\n<br \/><br \/>\nThe yellow gourd flower represents the royal colour, which signifies the Malay Sultanate. The bamboo shoot motif represents the educational process in moulding students into professional graduates. The Bunga Tanjung on the sheath represents the State of Selangor, where the main UiTM campus is located.\n<br \/><br \/>\nThe keris\u2019s authoritative identity is reflected by the UiTM logo on a silver carving at the top of the sheath. The middle part of the sheath is inscribed with the UiTM motto \"Usaha, Takwa, Mulia\" (Endeavour, Spirituality, Nobleness) in Khat Tuluth.\n<\/p>","alignment":""}},{"id":"ef344b8b-4dbd-4004-a59e-f750dd083436","name":"heading","visibility":true,"settings":{"admin_label":"The Tombak Agung","title":"<strong>The Tombak style=\"text-align:justify;\">\nThe Tombak Agung consists of a pair of long lances, one with a bamboo leaf-shaped blade and another with a five-curved blade, which represent religion, knowledge, and personality values, as well as the sovereignty of Malay society and the nation. The overall motif on the shaft of the spear is adapted from a design of a dome to symbolise UiTM as a font of knowledge, disseminating and receiving knowledge according to the law of knowledge towards creating the good and banishing the evil based on religious teachings, particularly among the undergraduates, all for the religion, the race and the nation.\n<br \/><br \/>\nThe blade with five curves represents the five Pillars of Islam, while the bamboo leaf-shaped blade symbolises the rich traditional Malay art. The decoration on the shaft begins with a traditional silver head-dress, which symbolises the responsibility of the Malay kings towards matters pertaining to Islam, as well as the pinnacle of Malay civilisation.\n<br \/><br \/>\nBelow the headdress is a silver inscription of UiTM's motto, \u201cUsaha, Takwa, Mulia,\u201d and the UiTM logo in Arabic calligraphy, followed by a silver engraving of Bunga Tanjung. The logo and motto represent UiTM as a premier institution of higher learning, established with the aspiration to produce Bumiputera graduates who have mastered knowledge and technology.\n<\/p>","alignment":""}}]}],"parent":false},{"id":"d91a3f21-5657-4caa-94d8-4782774540a1","visibility":true,"collapse":false,"settings":{"admin_label":"","fit_columns":{"xl":true,"sm":false},"background_type":"none","background_gradient":{"color":"#00c6fb","color2":"#005bea","deg":"45","type":"linear"},"background_image":{"src":""},"background_parallax":"0","background_repeat":"no-repeat","background_size":"cover","background_size_custom":{"unit":"px"},"background_attachment":"fixed","background_position":"0 style=\"text-align:justify;\">\nWujudmu di sini di tanah anak merdeka<br\/>\nBagai obor ilmu memayungi putra-putrinya<br\/>\nPelopor hidup, budaya bangsa, agama, negara<br\/>\nPembentuk akhlak manusia agar jadi sempurna<br\/>\nKu yang melangkah ke sini ingin mempelajari<br\/>\nRahsia di muka bumi dengan cara hakiki<br\/>\nTunjukkan aku jalan ilmuMU untukku menuju<br\/>\nDestinasi cita-cita negara dan bangsaku<br\/>\n<br\/>\nMajulah bangsa<br\/>\nMaju negara<br\/>\nBerkat usaha jaya MARA<br\/>\nKami berikrar akan berjasa<br\/>\nHingga kita Berjaya...demi bangsa<br\/>\n<br\/>\nWatikah yang ku miliki kan ku semat di hati<br\/>\nJanjiku pada pertiwi untuk menabur bakti<br\/>\nKu sempurnakan seikhlas hati membela negara<br\/>\nDoa restu ayah bonda ku untuk mu semua<br\/>\nUiTM...Usaha Taqwa style=\"text-align:justify;\"><\/p><ol><li><p style=\"text-align:justify;\">The diamond shape at the top of the five books symbolises the quality education obtained from studying at UiTM.<\/p><\/li><li><p style=\"text-align:justify;\">The five shapes that represent elevated books symbolise the varied areas and levels of study offered: Certificate, Diploma, Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral Degree. These five books also symbolise the five Pillars of Islam, which form the thrust of student development.<\/p><\/li><li><p style=\"text-align:justify;\">The image of books placed on a book rest (rihal) is the basis of the UiTM logo design. Books symbolise the source of knowledge. As an institution of higher learning, the core of all knowledge, including the fields of science and technology, disseminated to students, is based on knowledge from the Al-Quran and As-Sunnah.<\/p><\/li><li><p style=\"text-align:justify;\">The rihal symbolises the university as the platform to disseminate knowledge.<\/p><\/li><li><p style=\"text-align:justify;\">Two crossed keris symbolise the sovereignty of the Malay kings and the struggle of the Malays to uphold the excellence and sovereignty of the nation.<\/p><\/li><li><p style=\"text-align:justify;\">The partly polished diamond shape symbolises the role of UiTM in improving the status of Bumiputeras to become a successful community which is conscientious, religious, and dignified.<\/p><\/li><li><p style=\"text-align:justify;\">The round shape within the whole logo symbolises UiTM as a global, unique, and competitive university.<\/p><\/li><\/ol><p
